intro: Galium arequipicum, commonly known as the Arequipa bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Peru. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are opposite and often have a distinctive, waxy appearance. Galium arequipicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
